channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Over grown trees, not hedges, 2nd June
item.description:
Unsafe driving exiting Haymes Drive onto B4632 due to poor visibility due to trees and shrubs, both left and right.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haymes Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 2nd June
item.description:
Gulley appears to be sinking. Customer is concerned as this is a cobbled street, and the sand/concrete appears to be washing away and they fear this could collapse.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Five potholes in a row. Approx sizes - 3ft x2ft, 1ftx2ft, 2ftx2ft,3ftx2ft,1ftx1ft previously poorly repaired numerous times, 2nd June
item.description:
Sandycroft Road Churchdown GL3 - turn left at the top of Marleyfield way into Sandycroft Road potholes are in the centre of the road immediately ahead. Roughly outside 27 Sandycroft Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandycroft Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish is stream, 2nd June
item.description:
Looks like a school bag and the contents plus a large bottle of bubble mix or similar in the stream.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coffin Path, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 2nd June
item.description:
Customer reports that all of works at the location are complete - the holes are filled - but the lane closures and temp TS remain in place. They request that the TM is removed as it is causing chaos and holding up traffic/buses unnecessarily.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting: various giant banners attached all along railingsings, 2nd June
item.description:
On the railings round Cox's Meadow there are still several enormous banners /other flyposting by various organisations. It is a permanent problem now, with constant flyposting for many metres all along the railings. It's all year round.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Bath Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting by housing developer at traffic junction, 2nd June
item.description:
'New Dawn Homes' has put up fly posters on the street furniture at the junction of Gloucester Rd and St Georges Road. One is tied onto the furniture on left side of Gloucester Rd going north, the other is on the left side going south.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 140, Gloucester Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 2nd June
item.description:

item.title: They are ripping up the footpath for New lay boy, 2nd June
item.description:
It is on the corner of Philly Lane Lampton Road I reported this last week and still nothing has been done. It’s a public footpath which should be kept open yeah I started work again today. They did some work last week. I hope this problem will be sorted out today or tomorrow because children are back at school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dead Man's Incline, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Advanced stop lines need repainting in Cheltenham, 2nd June
item.description:
Locatiom: St George's place at juction with St George's Road, Cheltenham. Advanced stop lines and cycle logo within 'box' needs repainting. See photos of car ignoring this highway rule.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Saint Georges Place, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
